The choirs of Potsdam Central School were scheduled to perform in a District Chorus Night Concert on March 19, 2020, just five days after New York schools closed due to the COVID-19 Outbreak. "Music Changes The World" by Jim Papoulis was slated to be the final number of the concert, to be performed by all of the choral students in the district in a combined ensemble.

Some three months later, we am pleased to be able to share this song with you now, as performed by the PCS Combined Virtual Choir. Over 100 students in grades 5-12 participated to help bring this performance to life. The students showed incredible bravery, perseverance, and a true love of music.

This video is also going to be part of a 3-part Virtual Spring Concert that will be published next week, featuring solo performances by students from our district, so be on the lookout for those soon.

post_text: On Friday, April 10th, the Whiz Quiz team competed in a 3-2-1 national trivia competition from their homes using zoom. There are 240 questions in this 2-hour competition. Sylvi Teich also joined in the zoom meet to see what Whiz Quiz was all about.

They also learned strategies to take action and overcome the barriers that may exist to being an "upstander" rather than a "bystander." Finally, students learned how to choose their Trusted Adult as well as how to let a trusted adult know when they see warning signs or threats.
